data.name: audit_fullyengaged
data.value: Fully Engaged

data.name: audit_heading
data.value: Life Engagement Audit

data.name: audit_instr
data.value: Answer all of the questions using the time frame of the last six months. Select the number on a scale of 1-7 that corresponds to your engagement level.

data.name: ch_heading
data.value: Character Profile

data.name: ch_intro_extreme
data.value: Extreme/Gut-wrenching

data.name: ch_intro_para1
data.value: This questionnaire is designed to help you assess how you respond during periods of great stress or pain in your professional or personal life. The intent is to identify the strengths and weaknesses that surfaced when you are pushed well beyond your comfort zone physically, emotionally, mental or spiritually. Be as truthful and honest as you can. Resist the temptation to make yourself look better or worse than you were at the time of the stress exposure. An answer of 1 indicates this crisis exposed a significant weakness and a 5 indicates a significant strength was exposed.

data.name: ch_intro_para2
data.value: Below are examples of possible major stressors that may have occurred that could be referenced for responding to the items in this questionnaire. The intended purpose of this questionnaire is to surface who you really are during the worst of times in your life, when the forces of life have seemingly turned against you. It’s important that you reference a stressor that was more a deep personal crisis for you than for those around you.

data.name: ch_intro_q1
data.value: List the stressor or stressors that you will use as a reference for taking this questionnaire (preferably stressors that have occurred in the last 2 years).

data.name: ch_intro_q2
data.value: On a scale of 1 to 10, how intense was the stress?

data.name: ch_intro_title
data.value: Introduction

data.name: ch_intro_verymild
data.value: Very mild

data.name: ch_profile_i
data.value: I

data.name: ch_profile_stem
data.value: During times of personal crisis, |ParticipantName|:

data.name: consentrater_para1
data.value: Thank you for agreeing to provide survey responses for a participant in our courses.

data.name: consentrater_para2
data.value: Human Performance Institute Division of Wellness & Prevention, Inc. (“Wellness & Prevention”) provides this website and survey for the purpose of preparing individuals for our energy and performance programs (the “Program”). We understand that the information you will be sharing about the Program participant may be very personal. This Privacy Notice is designed to tell you about Wellness & Prevention’s practices regarding collection, use, and disclosure of the information you provide.

data.name: consentrater_para3
data.value: By completing these survey questions, you consent to the collection, processing, retention, and disclosure of the responses (e.g., related to the participant’s behavioral and lifestyle information, and other information that you provide us) by Wellness & Prevention, our business partners, and our service providers, together who use this information to administer the Program. We will not otherwise sell or give information you provide to other parties for purposes unrelated to the Program.

data.name: consentrater_para4
data.value: Wellness & Prevention takes reasonable steps to protect such information from loss, misuse, and unauthorized access, disclosure, alteration, or destruction.

data.name: consentrater_para5
data.value: You may reach us with questions and for other support regarding this survey by contacting:

data.name: consentrater_para6
data.value: Human Performance Institute Division of Wellness & Prevention, Inc. 9757 Lake Nona Rd. Orlando, FL 32827 USA +1.407.438.9911 info@corporateathlete.com

data.name: consentrater_para7
data.value: More information about our overall privacy practices, you may review our Program Privacy Statement. Use of this website is governed by its Legal Notice.

data.name: consentself_bullet1
data.value: Human Performance Institute Division of Wellness & Prevention, Inc., will keep information about me private, and will not voluntarily disclose the information except as described in the Privacy Statement.

data.name: consentself_bullet2
data.value: Information about me may be provided to the coaches supporting me related to these energy and performance programs.

data.name: consentself_bullet3
data.value: Wellness & Prevention may provide de-identified aggregate and statistical information about its participants:

data.name: consentself_bullet3a
data.value: To my sponsor (if applicable) and other supporting organizations for administering the programs

data.name: consentself_bullet3b
data.value: To other parties for their analysis and research.

data.name: consentself_bullet4
data.value: Wellness & Prevention and supporting organizations may contact me with program information and requests.

data.name: consentself_intro
data.value: Please carefully read the following along with our Privacy Statement and Legal Notice, as participation in the various Human Performance Institute programs require that you fully understand and consent to these terms:

data.name: consent_disagree

data.value: I have read and consent to the these terms and those detailed in the Privacy Statement and Legal Notice, and to the processing of personal information in the United States and other locations where data protection rules may differ from those of the country in which I reside.

data.name: health_heading
data.value: Health Profile

data.name: health_hour
data.value: hour

data.name: health_hours
data.value: hours

data.name: health_q16_1
data.value: Think about days you were limited in the amount or kind of work you could do, days you accomplished less than you would like, or days you could not do your work as carefully as usual. If low or negative energy affected your work only a little, choose a low number. Choose a high number if low or negative energy affected your work a great deal.

data.name: health_q16_2
data.value: Consider only how much low (or negative) energy affected productivity <u>while you were working. </u>

data.name: health_q17_1
data.value: By regular activities, we mean the usual activities you do, such as work around the house, shopping, childcare, exercising, studying, etc. Think about times you were limited in the amount or kind of activities you could do and times you accomplished less than you would like. If health problems affected your activities only a little, choose a low number. Choose a high number if health problems affected your activities a great deal.

data.name: health_q17_2
data.value: Consider only how much <u>low or negative energy levels</u> affected your ability to do your regular daily activities, other than work at a job.

data.name: legal_notice
data.value:
Legal Notice

All content in this portion of this website is owned or controlled by Human Performance Institute, Inc. and is protected by worldwide copyright laws. You may download content only for your personal use for non-commercial purposes but no modification or further reproduction of the content is permitted. The content may otherwise not be copied or used in anyway.

The owners of this site will use reasonable efforts to include up-to-date and accurate information in this website, but the owners and Human Performance Institute, Inc. make no representations, warranties, or assurances as to the accuracy, currency, or completeness of the information provided. The owners of this site and Human Performance Institute, Inc. shall not be liable for any damages or injury resulting from your access to, or inability to access, this website, or from your reliance on any information provided at this website.

This website may provide links or references to other sites but the owners of this site and Human Performance Institute, Inc. have no responsibility for the content of such other sites and shall not be liable for any damages or injury arising from that content. Any links to other sites are provided as merely a convenience to the users of this website.

The trademarks, service marks, trade names, trade dress and products in this website are protected in the U.S. and internationally. No use of any of these may be made without the prior, written authorization of the owners of this site, except to identify the products or services of the company.

Any personally identifiable information in electronic communications to this website is governed by this site's Privacy Statement. The owners of this site and Human Performance Institute, Inc. shall be free to use or copy all other information in any such communications, including any ideas, inventions, concepts, techniques or know-how disclosed therein, for any purposes. Such purposes may include disclosure to third parties and/or developing, manufacturing and/or marketing goods or services.

The sender of any communications to this website or otherwise to the owners of this site and Human Performance Institute, Inc. shall be responsible for the content and information contained therein, including its truthfulness and accuracy.

data.name: privacy_stmt
data.value:
Privacy Statement

This Privacy Statement is designed to tell you about the Human Performance Institute, Inc.’s (“Human Performance Institute”) practices regarding collection, use, and disclosure of information that you may provide via the Human Performance Institute portions of this website. This Privacy Statement also applies to E-mail communications that arise out of your completion of surveys on this website. Please be sure to read this entire Privacy Statement before using or submitting information to this website.

This portion of the website hosts Human Performance Institute surveys designed to compile information about you or someone you know for use in our administration of various health and wellness courses. Although your participation in the surveys is voluntary, their completion helps us to optimize our delivery of the courses to you or to the person about whom you are responding in the survey. Although the surveys are hosted and compiled, and the resultant E-mails sent by Performance Programs, Inc., a third party service provider, the pages you visit on the website and resultant E-mails are governed by this Privacy Statement.

By using portions of the website governed by this Privacy Statement, you agree to the terms of this Privacy Statement. Specifically, you consent to the collection, processing, retention, and disclosure of information you provide for the purposes described in this Privacy Statement.

Other portions of Performance Programs, Inc.’s website are not governed by the Human Performance Institute’s Privacy Statement.

Information that You Provide

This portion of the website maintains and uses information you provide (e.g., name, contact information, demographic information, health goals, health conditions, medications, claims, activities and lifestyle) about you or about another person(s) for whom you are responding to a survey request. The information is compiled as a product of your interactivity on the website. Some areas of this website may require you to submit information in order for you or someone you know to benefit from Human Performance Institute courses or to participate in a particular activity.

You will be informed at each information collection point what information is required and what information is optional.

Our Use of Information that You Provide; Disclosure to Third Parties

We, along with our business partners and service providers, use the survey information to provide various products and services, most notably our health and wellness courses. We will not use the information you provide in these surveys to promote our products or services. We will not otherwise sell or give this information to other parties for their marketing purposes.

We may disclose survey information to HealthMedia, Inc. and Wellness & Prevention, Inc., and other entities that comprise the Johnson & Johnson Family of Health and Performance Companies to which the Human Performance Institute belongs, who agree to treat the information in accordance with this Privacy Statement and use it for the specified purposes.

Except as otherwise stated, we may use information collected via this website to improve the content of our website, for research purposes, and for any other purposes specified. In addition, we may make full use of all information acquired through this website that is not in personally identifiable form.

If you provide personally identifiable information to this website, we may combine such information with other actively collected information unless we specify otherwise at the point of collection. We may disclose personally identifiable information you provide via this website to other Johnson & Johnson Operating Companies worldwide that agree to treat it in accordance with this Privacy Statement and use it for the same purposes.

We may disclose survey information to third parties that are not Johnson & Johnson Operating Companies, but will do so only: (i) to contractors we use to support our business (e.g., fulfillment services, technical support, delivery services, and financial institutions), in which case we will require such third parties to agree to treat the information according to terms consistent with this Privacy Statement and use it for specified purposes; (ii) in connection with the sale, assignment, or other transfer of the business of this website to which the information relates, in which case we will require any such buyer to agree to treat the information in accordance with this Privacy Statement and use it for the specified purposes; or (iii) to respond to law enforcement requests or where required by applicable laws, court orders, or government regulations.

Our affiliates, business partners, and service providers may process the survey information in the United States and in locations outside the United States.

Passive Information Collection

As you use the website, your browser or other device communicates with the servers involved to coordinate the interactivity and content that you request. Those servers, which include those operated by Performance Programs, Inc., Human Performance Institute, and also those of our other business partners and services providers, keep records of your interactivity and requests for services and content to assist us in managing and improving the utility of the website and in conducting research and analysis on the use of the website.

The types of such interactive information include your Internet protocol (IP) addresses, browser types, URLs of referring hyperlinks (i.e., if you clicked through to a page in our website), and related web usage information.

Such information is stored in web server logs and in web cookies kept on your computer or mobile device, which are then transmitted back to our website by your computer or mobile device. These servers are operated and the cookies managed by Performance Programs, Inc., our service provider.

Performance Programs, Inc. use cookies to store your user id and to subsequently authenticate you to the protected portions of the website, and to analyze how the website, E-mail communications, and related services are accessed and used. Performance Programs, Inc. also uses cookies from other service providers for these purposes. Acceptance of cookies by your browser is required for the correct functioning of this portion of website.

Performance Programs, Inc. and we, along with our business partners and service providers, use other similar techniques to record other interactivity information about the use of the website, E-mail communications, and related services, and to analyze how the website, E-mail communications, and related services are accessed and used.

Information about Children

Human Performance Institute does not offer programs to persons under the age of 18. Although program participants may invite their children to serve as raters to provide information about their parents, we do not knowingly collect information from persons under the age of 13. We encourage parents to talk to their children about their use of the Internet and the information that they disclose.

Managing Information about You: Opt-out Procedure

To keep information that you provide via this portion of the website accurate, current, and complete, please contact us as specified below and we will take appropriate steps to update or correct such information in our possession.

Security

Human Performance Institute, Inc. takes reasonable steps to protect personally identifiable information as you transmit it to our website and to protect such information from loss, misuse, and unauthorized access, disclosure, alteration, or destruction. You should keep in mind that no Internet transmission is ever completely secure or error-free. In particular, E-mail sent to or from this website may not be secure.

Links to Other Websites

This website may contain links and references to other websites that contain relevant information. Our Privacy Statement does not apply to such websites. We encourage you to become familiar with the privacy practices of the other websites that you use.

Contacting Us

If you have a comment or question about the use of the website, please contact us online or as follows:

Human Performance Institute, Inc.
9757 Lake Nona Rd., Orlando, FL 32827 USA
+1-407-438-9911
privacy@hpinstitute.com

Updates to Our Privacy Statement

As we update this Privacy Statement from time to time, we will post the revised statement on this website. Please check back periodically, and especially before you provide personal information. This Privacy Statement was last updated on October 19, 2011.

data.name: register_addheading
data.value: Add raters

data.name: register_bullet1
data.value:
Recommended volume of raters is 5 or more, as follows:
  • Supervisor/manager: 1 (minimum )
  • Peers: 2 or more
  • Direct reports: 2 or more
  • Friends/Family: any
  • Children: any

data.name: register_bullet2
data.value: If you do not have a minimum of 2 peers and 2 direct reports, the categories are combined in your report to preserve anonymity.

data.name: register_bullet3
data.value: Children questions are targeted at ages 7-18, and answer 6 questions designed for that age group. Any child over 18 is recommended to select "Family Member" to take the in-depth question set.

data.name: register_bullet4
data.value: You may use your own email address for children, if they don’t have one. Once they login, they should choose "child" as their relationship to you.

data.value: Current Raters

data.value: |Count| emails sent.

data.name: register_exists
data.value: This email address is in use. Please try again.

data.name: register_firstname
data.value: First Name

data.name: register_groupheading
data.value: Register to access the Seven Tudes

data.name: register_heading
data.value: Register Raters

data.name: register_instr
data.value: Please select the persons you would like to provide feedback for your 360 Seven Tudes. The raters you select will receive a subset of the questions asked of you. The questions they receive are based on their relationship to you, work-related versus friends & family. For example, personal habit-related items like nutrition or exercise are only asked of friends and family. There is no maximum on the number of raters, so please register as many as you would like.

data.name: register_instr2
data.value: <u>INSTRUCTIONS: </u>Enter the required information for each person, and click “Save (send emails)”. The system will then send out the invitation to the raters selected.

data.name: register_invalidemailaddress
data.value: Error Alert: One or more email addresses is invalid. Please see the entry marked with a red asterisk and re-enter the correct address.

data.name: register_lastname
data.value: Last Name

data.name: register_maxdate
data.value: Reminders Sent

data.name: register_nocurrentdata
data.value: You don't have any raters registered at this time.

data.name: register_note
data.value:
Note:
  • When adding a child as a rater you may use your own email address if they don't have one. When they log in they will select "child" as their relationship to you and this will take them to the children profile. Older children (18 or older) may take a more extensive profile by selecting "family member" instead of "child".
  • A rater receives a reminder email each time you click the "Send Reminders" button. The system sends reminders to only those raters who have not yet completed the profile.
  • Please make sure the email addresses that you enter for your raters are correct.

data.name: register_note2
data.value: Please Note: Email addresses ending with att.com, shaw.ca and sbcglobal.net may have difficulty in receiving these emails. To ensure delivery of the information, please utilize email addresses outside these domains, if possible.

data.name: register_note3
data.value: Automated reminders are sent to any rater who has <u>not</u> provided feedback by the response deadline.

data.name: register_previewemails
data.value: Preview Emails

data.name: register_reminders
data.value: Automatic reminder emails will be sent to any rater who has not provided feedback by the response deadline above. The date the most recent reminders were sent is shown below. You may choose to send reminders yourself by clicking on ’Send Reminders’.

data.name: register_reminders2
data.value: The most recent date that reminders were sent is displayed to the left. If you would like to send reminders yourself, simply click on the “Send Reminders” button. Reminders are sent only to those who have not completed their survey.

data.value: Number of responses received so far: |nn|

data.name: register_respinstr
data.value: (For confidentiality reasons, you will not see who has completed the profile.)

data.name: register_save
data.value: Save

data.name: register_savesend
data.value: Save (send emails)

data.name: register_sendreminders
data.value: Send Reminders

data.name: register_sentcount
data.value: |nn| message(s) sent

data.name: register_step1
data.value: Step 1: Use the table to the left to enter the names and email addresses of your raters.

data.name: register_step1a
data.value: Please note: Email addresses ending at att.com, shaw.ca and sbcglobal.net may have difficulty in receiving these emails. To ensure delivery of information to your raters, please utilize email addresses outside of these domains, if possible.

data.name: register_step2
data.value:
Step 2: Click the "Save" button located below the table. An email invitation will be automatically sent to your raters with instructions to complete the 360 Seven Tudes.

Raters may include: peers, direct reports, manager/supervisor, friends, family members and children (age 7-18). Please select as many raters as you would like as there is no maximum that you may input. At least 5 rater responses are needed in order to generate your report. A minimum of 2 peer responses and 2 direct report responses are needed, or these groups will be combined in the report in order to provide anonymity to the raters.

Once you have entered your raters, you can view and edit them in the lower half of this page as well as send reminder emails. You may log back in at any time to add any additional Raters and/or to track your rater responses by the tally given below.

data.name: rel_continue
data.value: Continue

data.name: rel_heading
data.value: Please select the relationship

data.name: rel_instr1

data.name: rel_instr2
data.value: If you are a child between the ages of 7 and 18, please select "Child" as the relationship. If you are a child over 18, please select "Family" as the relationship.

data.name: rel_instr3
data.value: * Most questions are multiple choice and those responses are reported in aggregate. Responses to open-ended (write in) questions may be identifiable as your response by the person you are rating based on the specifics of what you state in your response.

data.name: prev_rater_header
data.value: Select Previous Raters.

data.name: prev_rater_addnew
data.value: Add Raters

data.name: prev_rater_instr
data.value: On the next two pages you will select the people who you would like to give feedback for your 360 Seven Tudes. The raters will receive a subset of the questions asked of you. The questions they receive are based on their relationship to you, work-related versus friends and family.

data.name: prev_rater_instr2
data.value: This page shows all the raters that you had selected for your previous 360. We highly encourage you to select all of these raters again. However, you are not required to do so. You will have the opportunity to add additional raters on the following screen. Please review the list of previous raters below and select those you would like to participate in this assessment. When finished, click Next to continue.

data.name: prev_rater_next_alert
data.value: Please review your selections. You will not be able to return to this screen.

data.name: rater_dup_alert
data.value: The following duplicate email addresses have been found. Please review and update:

data.name: default_instr_t2
data.value: Please use the codes you have been provided to begin your Seven Tudes.

data.name: default_participants_t2
data.value: The Seven Tudes is the Human Performance Institute's most comprehensive online assessment tool. The profile focuses on behaviors in each of the four energy dimensions (physical, mental, emotional, and spiritual). It provides awareness of strengths as well as uncovers opportunities for growth in each energy dimension.

data.name: register_ch_groupheading
data.value: Register to access the NorthStar Assessment

data.name: thanks_rater_ch
data.value: Thank you for completing the Northstar Assessment. Your responses will be combined with those from other raters and included in this person's feedback report.

data.name: default_heading_ch
data.value: Welcome to the NorthStar Assessment

data.name: default_instr_ch
data.value: Please use the codes provided to you to begin your assessment.

data.name: default_participants_ch
data.value: We are excited about your upcoming training with the Human Performance Institute. The assessment(s) you will be completing are an integral part of the training you will be attending.
